text: It's far easier to forgive an enemy after you've got even with him.

author: Joseph J. Ellis
text: And the only thing to do with a sin is to confess, do penance and then, after some kind of decent interval, ask for forgiveness.

author: Ausonius
text: Forgive many things in others; nothing in yourself.

author: Billy Graham
text: Man has two great spiritual needs. One is for forgiveness. The other is for goodness.

author: bell hooks
text: For me, forgiveness and compassion are always linked: how do we hold people accountable for wrongdoing and yet at the same time remain in touch with their humanity enough to believe in their capacity to be transformed?

author: Jim Bakker
text: God's forgiveness is the only thing. And, well, I take full responsibility for the adultery. It was my fault and, you know, no matter what went on, the man has to take responsibility; and I do.

author: Janine Turner
text: My desire is to stand up and brush myself off when I make mistakes and ask for forgiveness.

author: Hillary Clinton
text: In the Bible it says they asked Jesus how many times you should forgive, and he said 70 times 7. Well, I want you all to know that I'm keeping a chart.

author: Mary Boykin Chesnut
text: Forgiveness is indifference. Forgiveness is impossible while love lasts.

author: Harriet Beecher Stowe
text: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.

author: T. D. Jakes
text: We think that forgiveness is weakness, but it's absolutely not; it takes a very strong person to forgive.

author: Karl Barth
text: It is always the case that when the Christian looks back, he is looking at the forgiveness of sins.

author: Louise L. Hay
text: Forgiveness is for yourself because it frees you. It lets you out of that prison you put yourself in.

author: Joan Baez
text: As we know, forgiveness of oneself is the hardest of all the forgivenesses.

author: Dick Van Dyke
text: Just knowing you don't have the answers is a recipe for humility, openness, acceptance, forgiveness, and an eagerness to learn - and those are all good things.

author: Grace Poe
text: It's always best to ask for forgiveness if you feel that you made a mistake. And again, asking for forgiveness is not just saying the words 'I'm sorry'; it is also offering what you need to do.

author: Adam Hamilton
text: Jesus' own witness of sacrificial love and forgiveness, and his work to heal the sick and care for those in need, represent God's ways and vision for us.

author: Monica Johnson
text: It's only through Christ that we can take full advantage of God's mercy and forgiveness through repentance in Jesus' name.

author: Thomas Fuller
text: He that cannot forgive others breaks the bridge over which he must pass himself; for every man has need to be forgiven.

author: William Arthur Ward
text: Forgiveness is a funny thing. It warms the heart and cools the sting.
